item.title: @elonmusk: Unreal. Sixth grade students at a Kansas public school were told they could not name Charlie Kirk as...
item.description: Unreal. Sixth grade students at a Kansas public school were told they could not name Charlie Kirk as a role model for an assignment. The assignment was called â€œFind Your Voice,â€ in which the students were asked to identify their role models. â€œWhen a student identified Charlie Kirk as a role model, [the guidance counselor] got very uncomfortable and refused to allow this name to be written on the board, yelling that he was â€˜not a hero,â€™ and that he was not a role model." Another kid said President Trump, and this was also denied. Yet another student said Jesus, and once again this was denied. A lawsuit has been filed which claims other "controversial" role models were allowed, just not conservative or Christian ones. Get your kids out of public school, folks.
